metadata.title: CVE-2022-48541 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A memory leak in ImageMagick 7.0.10-45 and 6.9.11-22 allows remoteattackers to perform a denial of service via the "identify -help" command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm9').
